empty_state.title: Configure a New Upstream
empty_state.description: Upstreams are used to load balance incoming requests.

toolbar_actions.new_upstream_tooltip: An Upstream represents a virtual hostname and can be used to load balance incoming requests over multiple Gateway Services.

search.placeholder: Filter by exact name or ID

delete.title: Delete an Upstream
delete.description: This action cannot be reversed so make sure to check upstream usage before deleting.

errors.delete: The upstream could not be deleted at this time.

errors.in_range: Accepts an integer in the range of 10 - 65536

general_info.title: General Information
general_info.help: General information will help identify and manage this Upstream.

load_balancing.title: Load Balancing
load_balancing.help: Active health checks actively probe targets for their health. Currently only support HTTP/HTTPS targets.

health_check.title: Health Checks & Circuit Breakers
health_check.help: Active health checks actively probe targets for their health. Currently only support HTTP/HTTPS targets.

active_health_check.title: Active Health Checks
active_health_check.help: Active health checks actively probe targets for their health. Currently only support HTTP/HTTPS targets.

passive_health_check.title: Passive Health Checks
passive_health_check.help: Passive health checks, also known as circuit breakers, are checks performed based on the requests being proxied by Kong (HTTP/HTTPS/TCP), with no additional traffic being generated.

hash_on_header.text: The header name to take the value from as hash input. Only required when {hash_on} is set to {header}

hash_on_uri_capture.text: The name of the route URI capture to take the value from as hash input. Only required when {hash_on} is set to {uri_capture}

hash_on_query_arg.text: The name of the query string argument to take the value from as hash input. Only required when {hash_on} is set to {query_arg}

hash_on_cookie.text: The cookie name to take the value from as hash input. Only required when {hash_on} or {hash_fallback} is set to {cookie}. If the specified cookie is not in the request, Kong will generate a value and set the cookie in the response.

hash_on_cookie_path.text: The cookie path to set in the response headers. Only required when {hash_on} or {hash_fallback} is set to {cookie}.

slots.text: The number of slots in the load balancer algorithm. If {algorithm} is set to {round_robin}, this setting determines the maximum number of slots. If {algorithm} is set to {consistent_hashing}, this setting determines the actual number of slots in the algorithm. Accepts an integer in the range {min}-{max}

hash_tooltips.tags: An optional set of strings associated with the Upstream for grouping and filtering.

hash_fallback.text: What to use as hashing input if the primary {hash_on} does not return a hash (eg. header is missing, or no Consumer identified). Not available if {hash_on} is set to {cookie}

hash_fallback_header.text: The header name to take the value from as hash input. Only required when {hash_fallback} is set to {header}

hash_fallback_query_arg.text: The name of the query string argument to take the value from as hash input. Only required when {hash_fallback} is set to {query_arg}

hash_fallback_uri_capture.text: The name of the route URI capture to take the value from as hash input. Only required when {hash_fallback} is set to {uri_capture}

host_header.text: The hostname to be used as {host} header when proxying requests through Kong.

hash_tooltips.client_certificate: If set, the certificate to be used as client certificate while TLS handshaking to the upstream server.

healthy.label: Healthy
healthy.help: The counter thresholds to determine whether targets are healthy.

unhealthy.label: Unhealthy
unhealthy.help: The counter thresholds to determine whether targets are unhealthy.

passive_healthy.label: Healthy
passive_healthy.help: The counter thresholds to determine whether targets are healthy.

passive_unhealthy.label: Unhealthy
passive_unhealthy.help: The counter thresholds to determine whether targets are unhealthy.

name.label: Name
name.tooltip: This is a hostname, which must be equal to the {host} of a Service.

client_certificate.label: Client Certificate
client_certificate.placeholder: Select or enter a Certificate ID
client_certificate.tooltip: If set, the certificate to be used as client certificate while TLS handshaking to the upstream server.

tags.label: Tags
tags.placeholder: Enter a list of tags separated by comma
tags.tooltip: An optional set of strings associated with the Upstream for grouping and filtering.

algorithm.label: Algorithm
algorithm.tooltip: Which load balancing algorithm to use.

slots.label: Slots
slots.help: Accepts an integer in the range of 10 - 65536

hash_on.label: Hash on
hash_on.help: What to use as hashing input.
hash_on.tooltip: What to use as hashing input. Using {result} results in a weighted-round-robin scheme with no hashing.

hash_fallback.label: Hash Fallback
hash_fallback.help: What to use as hashing input if the primary hash_on does not return a hash
hash_fallback.tooltip: What to use as hashing input if the primary {hash_on} does not return a hash (eg. header is missing, or no Consumer identified). Not available if {hash_on} is set to {cookie}.

active_health_checks.label: Active Health Checks
active_health_checks.help: Actively probe the targets for their health.

passive_health_checks.label: Passive Health Checks / Circuit Breakers
passive_health_checks.help: Checks performed based on the requests being proxied by Kong (HTTP/HTTPS/TCP), with no additional traffic being generated.

headers.label: Headers
headers.tooltip_active: Header values can be separated by commas (value1, value2, value3).

verify_ssl.label: Verify the SSL certificate when performing active health checks using HTTPS

interval.label: Interval
interval.help: A value of zero indicates that active probes for healthy targets are disabled.

empty_state.title: Configure a New Target
empty_state.description: A target is an IP address/hostname with a port that identifies an instance of a backend service.

delete.title: Delete a Target
delete.description: This action cannot be reversed so make sure to check target usage before deleting.

errors.delete: The target could not be deleted at this time.
errors.weight: Value must be in range 0 to 65535

target.label: Target Address
target.tooltip: The target address (IP or hostname) and port. If omitted the port defaults to 8000.

weight.label: Weight
weight.tooltip: The weight of this target in relation to other targets in the upstream. Value must be in range 0 to 65535, defaults to 100.

tags.label: Tags
tags.placeholder: Enter a list of tags separated by comma
